attributes.action: keep a fully staffed HMRC office open in Alnwick, Northumberland.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
HMRC are looking to withdraw presence from Bondgate Hall, Alnwick. 

They have already announced their intention to close the Morpeth office & Hexham is also under review; in all probability by 2010 Northumberland will be left without a departmental presence.

HMRC have stated that where there is an Enquiry Centre a presence will be retained - they have not specified what that provision is likely to be; it is of our opinion that this could be considerably limited compared to services that presently exist. 

The Alnwick office plays a major & central part in the community. Its closure will have a detrimental impact on local economy & would leave most, if not all, staff no choice but to travel on an already congested arterial route to Newcastle.  Not only will this cause a major impingement on their work/life balance it would also be, in effect, a significant pay cut to the staff.  

With Government plans for Sustainable Development how is this taking positive steps to protect the future?
